Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: M_and_B_Belfast
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. Checked in at 10pm and found three reception staff on duty. All of them spoke excellent English and provided a smiling witty and charming welcome to our party. Check in was quickly accomplished and on the advice of the staff we accepted the special rate for pre booking our breakfast which saved us approximately 25% off the standard price of 19 euros. Breakfast was the standard buffet fare of sausage, bacon eggs, toast, croissants, cold cuts, cheese, cereal etc. It was delicious but even at the reduced price of 14 euro i thought it was expensive,especially if you simply prefer cereal, tea and toast. Given the standard of the hotel which was excellent i suppose you could say the very competitive room rate compensated for the breakfast rates. The hotel is very modern in style and spotlessly maintained throughout including the fitness suite and sauna on the top floor. The stylish bar area was comfortable and served until 1am with plenty of waiting and bar staff who were very attentive and made sure no one had to wait for service. In fact if i had to choose which aspect of the hotel impressed most it would be the staff. There were lots of them, they all spoke English, they were invariably polite, friendly and genuinely seemed to enjoy interacting with and providing a superb service for the guests. e.g. I asked at reception for an iron and board, went straight to my room and as i reached my room and opened my door the items arrived and were set up for me. Fantastic service. The staff at the Concierge desk were superb, very friendly and really helpful in advising us what to see, how to get around, how to get best value from the transport passes they provided. Finally , the location of the hotel, Less than 15min walk from Alexander platz or just a few minutes in a tram. You can get a tram, S train or U train to anywhere in Berlin from here. In the railway arches under the S train station here there are some excellent restaurants serving great food at great prices. I think you will struggle to get better value than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb room at very little cost”
Reviews.Author: jetsetmark
Reviews.Content: We went for the upgrade to a superior room even though the regular rooms looked pretty good in the photo. It was only another £30 over 3 nights for the room to upgrade. Total bargain. Luxurious room. The only reason i can see for it being offered at this price is either the glut of quality hotel competition in the city and/or its location as it is only slightly out of the way. but it really isnt. it is a ten minute walk to Alexanderplatz and the bus 200 and the trams are right in front of the hotel. great little cafe on the corner for wine/rolls/drinks/internet access and the Kaiser supermarket round the corner for everything else. great city and great hotel. service was excellent, smiling and chatty - not a trace of german frostiness.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable value for money after a full-day of sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: TrueMat
Reviews.Content: Booked via the Otel.com site. Superb value for money B&B. Breakfast was always busy but plenty of choice on offer - a nice touch was a glass of fizzy as it was Easter Sunday! Rooms were as to be expected, large enough - fantastic shower (no bath) serviced every day. Location is great if you like to explore the City. The M4 tram which runs less than every 10minutes takes you to Alexanderplatz in about 5 minutes. From there, you can get to anywhere/ everywhere! Buy the ABC 7-day travel ticket on arrival at the train station by the airport. At €33.50 this was a bargain! If you are a walker then to Alexanderplatz takes about 15minutes. Facilities: All Staff very professional & friendly. There is a concierge (multi-lingual) and the Hotel will store your luggage at no extra cost on your day of Departure! An added bonus! The Bar is suitable for groups or single people, more expensive than elsewhere in the City but to be expected. Cafe-bakery/ Kebab/ Vietnemese Restaurant/ small Grocery Store all nearby (tram-stop vacinity) Outside the Hotel are a couple of these: http://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stolperstein Suggestions of things to experience: Dinner at the top of the TV Tower but book online. http://tv-turm.de/en/restaurant.php A 'Berlin Underground' Tour http://berliner-unterwelten.de/berlin-underground.8.1.html#re_2 Get there EARLY to ensure you get tickets! Fab City, fab hotel - enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to Alexanderplatz”
Reviews.Author: Nils_York
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week in March 2012. I recommend it because of the location (two tram stops away from Alex), price and the general standard of the room. I would only like to point out that you need to specify in your reservation that you want a king-sized bed. Otherwise they'll give you two single beds pushed together. We asked for a room facing the inner courtyard and it was pleasently silent. Nice and bright in the morning, but the curtains black out the light if needed. You can open the windows, which is always a big plus in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Guest Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: hutton25
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this hotel for comfort,clean rooms and breakfast service. My big complaint is that upon check in I was asked for my credit card for a deposit of 150 euros for room service and mini bar services.Despite that I told reception that I would not require these services I was told it was company policy.At the end of my stay and check out I asked Reception if I had incured any extra charges and I had not but my 150 euros would not be repaid for between 3 to 7 days. Customer satisfaction is not a word this hotel understands.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slorben
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend and really liked the place. Staff is very friendly and helpful all around. The place is very clean, one of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed in. The rooms are great, newly renovated and comfortable. Bathroom was excellent with everything you need and a shower that didn't leak any water. Beds are comfortable and it's a good feature that you can open the top windows to get fresh air. The area around the hotel is quiet with a big park across the street. Getting to other spots in Berlin is easy. Taxi is pretty cheap and there is S-bahn as well as U-bahn within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great East Berlin Property”
Reviews.Author: onetoomanytrips
Reviews.Content: traveling to Berlin for a combined holiday with my mother and work meetings we found the property online at a heavily reduced price of around €80. The property is about 15min walk from Alexanderplatz or 30min cab from Tegel airport. Modern property with all mod cons and English speaking reception staff. The room we booked was small but clean and new but we didn't spend much time at all in the room as the city has so much to offer. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would stay again on the same price point.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service, if a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: summerhouse2
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at the last minute for the Travel Fair ITB and we were charged much more than the usual rate with no breakfast included. After complaining I was offered a special business package of breakfast (normally €14) plus wifi (normally about €12) for just €16. This was good value as I had work to do in the mornings and evenings. Room was quite large, well furnished with a double bed, sofa, chair, desk etc. Bed was comfortable but the pillows were absolutely awful, very lumpy. Had to ask for an iron and some more clothes hangers but these arrived within ten minutes. Breakfast was usual cosmopolitan buffet, with plenty of choice and great pot of coffee. L checked out early on my last morning (4.00am) to go to the airport and was provided with a very nice packed lunch box. All in all can't really complain, apart from the awful pillows, but I tnink you need to haggle on the room rate and include the business package. Nice restaurant with an imaginative and reasonably priced menu by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ChelmsfordPete
Reviews.Content: We go away for a few nights every February and we like to try different places. This time we went to Berlin and discovered a great hotel near Alexanderplatz. We booked through an agency and the total cost for 3 nights was £168, Bed & Breakfast. The Leonardo Royal is about 15 minutes walk from the rail station and shopping centre of Alexanderplatz. Our Standard room (No Smoking) was just right for us. Very nicely decorated and appointed. Tea & coffee making in room, mini bar, TV, small safe, etc etc. Breakfast was a FULL range of hot and cold dishes - so varied I couldn't have eaten one of everything if we'd stayed there a fortnight!! Breakfast was €14 per person - so that would have accounted for almost half the amount we paid for the hotel with breakfast (in the deal we had). Very clean, nice bar and excellent service by all staff - it reminded me of some of the better business hotels I have stayed in during my working years. We saw most of the sights on foot - Brandenburg Gate, Rathaus etc etc. For those wishing to visit sights further afield, there is an excellent transport system with Underground & overground trains, trams, buses and very reasonably priced taxis. If we go to Berlin again we wouldn't even look at other hotels, we would just go straight to The Leonardo Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: Rich P
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, excellent service, bar, rooms, food, staff.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value during this "All hotels increase their rates" period of February.”
Reviews.Author: C T
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are very pleasant and helpful. The hotel has a very nice buffet breakfast daily for €19 (during our stay). Walking distance to Alexanderplatz and train station, but can be 10-20 minutes depending on how QUICK you walk. We walked to gendarmenmarkt and that was over 30 minutes. We stayed in a junior suite with a king bed. This is Europe, so the room is spacious for Europe with the twins put together. The room had many windows on two sides which was very nice and next to the church.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Comfort in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: CornwallVictoria
Reviews.Content: The Royal Leonardo was a great place for us to explore Berlin from. Right on the tram line, central to Alexanderplatz (5 minutes by tram to hotel), very comfortable bed with windows that open - funky historic east german building. There are many well priced restaurants within walking distance, good Saturday market, large park around the corner for running etc. Priced through hotwire was a good deal. The only issue is - glass shower fronts into room so friends rooming together may not appreciate that. Had 4 computers in office centre for free internet use, restaurant (which we didn't frequent), really helpful staff. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , Good Value”
Reviews.Author: dov48
Reviews.Content: This is a very new hotel with friendly staff and modern design , amazing breakfast ,nice and clean room. Good location - 2 minute from Alexanderplaz ,shopping center and TV Tower .

Reviews.Title: “goooood”
Reviews.Author: tigerShfaram
Reviews.Content: nice hotel ; very clean ; what breakfast ; ( somthing realy ) the staff very helpful ; they make the max to help clients to achieve there affairs in berlin nice location to alexanderplats (shopping & restaurants area ) far away 10 min. from postdam square .

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: christy m
Reviews.Content: we (couple) stayed for 4 nights,the staff were very nice. the location 2 tram stops to alexanderplatz.the breakfast was very good, the best we had in any hotel we stayed in europe.our room was quiet, could not find one fault with this hotel, will stay there next time we visit berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortabe”
Reviews.Author: TeroJ
Reviews.Content: We had business meeting at the hotel, everything went as planned. Wifi worked well

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ben C
Reviews.Content: We (couple) stayed for a week in the Leonardo royal hotel in the basic room. the hotel is very well located - only 2 tram stops from Alexanderplatz (the east-berlin center) tram is less than 100m from the hotel. from Alexanderplatz you can get anywhere in berlin using trains. the staff was very kind and helpful. The room was lovely - really quiet and cozy and the bed was very comfortable. We slept 9 hours every day! (we don't consider ourselves over-sleepers) Only downside - in USA 90% of 3 star hotels have free Wifi too bad this hotel doesn't. Also, some may find the room a bit small. a few tips: Tickets for the train are available directly from the reception. Best and cheapest way to get from the airport to the hotel is by train - Taxi = 60euro Train = 6euro Don't forget to validate your train ticket (ask what it means at the reception)

Reviews.Title: “A great base to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: trips365
Reviews.Content: In October, we made a trip to Germany for 2 weeks, making Berlin our base. Each time when we would come back, we always chose a different hotel – we ended up staying in 3 hotels: Hilton Berlin on Gendarmenmarkt, Leonardo Royal Hotel Berlin and PLUS Hotel Berlin. I will post reviews of each hotel separately. This one is about Leonardo Royal. Leonardo Royal is located near the Friedrichainspark. Although they bill themselves as Alexanderplatz hotel, it will be more appropriate to call it a hotel not far from Alexanderplatz (I would say about 700 meters from the western part of the Platz). It is a converted office building and you do feel it inside, especially in the corridors. There is a nice stylish restaurant on the ground floor. We did not try it for dinner but did have breakfast there. It is 9.60 euro if you prepay your stay and 12 euro if you pay at check in. The breakfast was awesome; we would rate is higher than at Hilton on Gendarmenmarkt where we stayed later and where it was exactly 3 times more expensive. We did not use the exercise room (only cardio) or sauna. But the view from it was great – you can see the TV tower or a nearby church. We loved it; we love to walk or bike, so a bit remote location of the hotel was fine. But if you have problems walking, then it might not be for you. Aside from a steakhouse and a restaurant on premises, there is nothing else nearby. But again, just a short walk north, to Prenzlauer Berg and you will have a lot to choose from. Can not recommend this place high enough, we’ll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fotsam
Reviews.Content: We've stayed for 5 nights at Leonardo.The room was a standard double and it was very good,clean and refurbished.The hotel is about 10 minutes from Alexanderplatz where you can find many shops,bars, restaurant etc and most important all the means of public transportation. The staff was polite and friendly. i would stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Would book this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: DiverAMEN
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and good location. Takes only 10 minutes to walk to very good restaurants and 10-15 minutes to the Moll and other shops. The rooms are a bit small but clean and looks like newly refurbished. (We had 6 rooms all similar). Quick clean up and making of the bed is done while you are at breakfast. Breakfast table consist of all kinds of "jucy stuff" and the service is good but not excellent. At the hotel bar and at the front desk the service was excellent. If I'm going back to Berlin I will consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel close to transport links”
Reviews.Author: hearty100
Reviews.Content: went with my daughter, had a twin room which was clean comfortable and quiet. beds were comfy, shower was fantastic and breakfast was excellent, plenty of choice and good quality food. Reception staff were friendly and welcoming, particularly the lady who checked us in who was very pleasant. Although the hotel was in a quiet location the tram stop was 2 minutes walk away which meant you were in main part of city within 5 mins, tram was very frequent. Would recommend this hotel as a value for money comfortable place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Well located for walkers”
Reviews.Author: bogdann
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, minor problem with the room and we were moved to another with no fuss. Staff are friendly, rooms are excellent and very clean. The restaurant was very impressive. Even though they had a conference dinner at the same time we were seated in a quiet area but not forgotten. If you like walking this is close to most sites from Alexanderplatz to Museum Island. A bit further to the Brandenburg Gate and the Government district.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: samil
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel which I wholeheartedly recommend in all aspects

Reviews.Title: “Unique and unexpected”
Reviews.Author: kkbirds
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel based on location - I was on a business trip and this was the closest to my office. But wow am I glad I did! Rooms are extra large, with couches and tv in a den area, a desk and business-type space and big modern bathrooms. The bed was my favorite part - very comfortable and quiet, I never wanted to get up in the morning. Plus the bright colored walls and artwork help to make it feel like more than a hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful (even Googling my office address to give me directions :). Thanks, I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Bath_rugby_fan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 night stay at this hotel. We found the hotel clean, quiet and comfortable and enjoyed the breakfasts. The staff were all very pleasant, particularly the concierge, who took every trouble to help us. The aircon was a little noisy and not very effective - we ended up just opening the window and because we were facing the inner courtyard of the hotel there was virtually no noise at all from traffic. The hotel is very well located for public transport and buying the 5 day Berlin Welcome pass (for S-U Bahns, trams and buses) at the hotel made it a very convenient and cost-effective way of getting about. It is in the East of the city and so some sights eg. Spandau and Schloss Charlottenburg seem like a long way away on the S-Bahn, but conversely it is easy to get to some of the up and coming places such as Prenzlauer Berg for the evening. Tha bar was quite expensive but nowhere near as bad as a London hotel. Overall we very much enjoyed our stay, found it good value for money, and would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caz754
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here 2 weeks ago for 4 nights. The hotel was lovely, staff were fabulous and breakfast was amazing. Room was slightly on the small side but then that happens in a lot of hotels in a big city. The tram is right outside and that will take you to the city centre........everything you could want.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent location"”
Reviews.Author: WILMSGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Only a 4min trip on tram M4 from Alexanderplatz to hotel-tram stop very near to hotel. Worth buying a Berlin Welcome card ( available at travel desk at Schoenfield Airport-3 day or 5 day pass which allows unlimited travel on trains,trams and buses within berlin city centre, surrounding areas and to and from airport. Also gives you 25-50% discounts of 100's of popular attractions. A 10-15 min walk from hotel to the Prenzlauer Berg area which has many different restaurants including spanish, russian, thai and german cuisine. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. Excellent buffet breakfast,plentiful and varied. Very relaxing and pleasant bar area-drinks resonable price for 4 star hotels. Rooms very clean and well maintained,good AC and comfortable beds but pillows very soft!! However on last night of stay noticed you could phone housekeeping and request alternative pillows! Would highly recommend hotel due to location,staff and cleanliness-very efficiently run!

Reviews.Title: “WiFi rip off and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: benry62
Reviews.Content: I absolutely resent paying €17 per day per device for WiFi - and then getting a pretty mediocre service from it. It is like being charged for the hot water. Beds were very uncomfortable - and unless they get a lot of incontinent people staying at the hotel there is no excuse for a plastic under sheet. Made it very unpleasant. Would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent 4* hotel within walking distance of Alexanderplatz”
Reviews.Author: L-Man77
Reviews.Content: Lovely example of a better standard of 4* hotel and well worthy of its 4* status.Staff were very efficient, friendly and courteous. The room was large and spacious with a large comfortable bed and and a large area to relax in with 2 comfortable armchairs.An iron and ironing board were a nice bonus.I also particularly liked the large LCD TV which swivelled round from the end of the bed to face the other side of the room. The bathroom was more than adequate with a seperate wc.Nice toiletries too.My only gripe with the room was that the bath was at a peculiar angle and required some gymnastics to negotiate your way into it! Wi fi was available but the hotel charged for it.However there were 4 pcs to use in the lobby free of charge. Only ate the breakfast here which was on a par with most 4* hotels.Nice bar area on the ground floor, however the top floor bar was no longer in service ,likewise the wellness centre. Although my geography of Berlin is not fantastic the surrounding buildings were typical of East Berlin(ie very drab!) but this didn't detract from my stay. It was a 10 minute walk from Alexanderplatz and the metro, so location wise not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeeBee386
Reviews.Content: We had a deluxe room and found it to be spacious and comfortable. I especially appreciated the sofa when I had trouble sleeping one night and got up to read so as not to disturb my partner. I wasn't thrilled with the immediate area...I found it bland and unappealling, but we were easy walking distance to Prenslauer Berg and Mitte which are charming and have good restaurants. My biggest complaint is instant coffee in the room. In the U>S> even the cheapest hotels give you a little pot with real coffee, and our hotel in Amsterdam the week before had Nespresso machines in the room, so I was disappointed to find instant which I loathe. No worries though, a bakery on the corner had excellent espresso and breakfast pastries. The highlight of the hotel was the wonderful concierge who was a very sweet man and wealth of information and even taught me a little German. Alles ist gut!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, outstanding staff, wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Paulo F
Reviews.Content: very good location, clean facilities, outstanding staff really willing to serve, very rich and well organized breakfast, fair rate. What else do you need from a hotel?

Reviews.Title: “A good value 4* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Merigreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Leonardo Royal Berlin for a total of 8 nights and overall our stay was fine, though I would level some critics at the hotel (most of them minor, but one of them more serious, and this last one the hotel managment should consider). I will list below all the positive and negative points in my opinion: - Price is one of its main advantages. Very competitive for a 4* hotel. - The hotel is conveniently located, 15 minutes walking from AlexanderPlatz (or just 5 minutes by tram). - The area is beautiful. The hotel itself is located in a wide avenue with a lot of traffic in the East part of the city, but there is a beautiful huge park nearby and Prenzlauer Berg district is also very close (there are loads of cafés and restaurants there). - Our room was comfortable, a bit small, but it had all the required comforts. The only thing I disliked was the bed, which in my opinion was too soft. The bathroom and shower were fine aswell. One detail I disliked, though, was that some toiletries such like toothpaste, toothbrushes, razors, paper tissues... were not directly left at the bathroom for us to use them, but we had to ask for them at reception or to the room-service staff (great idea, what what happens if there are only two people working at the room-service per plant in a hotel with so many rooms and when there is a long queue at the reception desk at all times? It happens that I had to go to the supermarket to buy all toiletries to safe me a long queue. -Cleanness. This is the main negative point. On the first day I found rests of hair and nails in the bathroom floor and drawers. I communicated it to the reception personal, but though they assured they would take care of it, the hairs made us company through all our stay (8 nights!). They also forgot to wash the tea mugs most of the days. This is a shame for a 4* hotel and a real pity, for all the rest was fine. - Extras. Wi-Fi access was extremely expensive (15€ per day), thought the hotel has a business center equipped with some computers and a printer, so it is possible to access to the Internet for free. Also, the minibar prices were exorbitant.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay in East Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: Peperj
Reviews.Content: Although it's a 15 min walk from Alexander Platz, this hotel is a good option to stay in Berlin. Clean room, quiet and with an amazing view of the TV Tower from the Mitte district. The breakfast was excellent and the staff were very helpful and friendly. The only thing I think it could be better was the bathroom, very small for the standard of the hotel, shower only, no bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, been here several times. Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Caspartje
Reviews.Content: This is simply an excellent hotel; staff is very fiendly, excellent value for money with spacious rooms, large plasma screens and parking space (not very cheap though). The bar is very nice and the breakfast is excellent! Hotel is at the border of Friedrichshain and Prenzlauer Berg, the two places to be in Berlin. Just a 15-min walk to Alexanderplatz; the hotel is not located near a U-Bahn or S-Bahn station, but the tram is right next door. No free WiFi though; first time I stayed here I could access the (WiFi) internet via Skype at a very low rate, last time this was not possible anymore. Hotel would be be perfect if they would offer free WiFi access. Would definitely go back here (and probably will soon).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - 10 minutes to Alexanderplatz by foot”
Reviews.Author: ELENAPAPATHENS
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 6 nights. Very good value for money! PROS: The room was sufficiently spacious and very clean. The staff was very friendly. The buffet had a variety of breakfast goodies. The air-conditioning worked nicely and at night you could here nothing from the other rooms. The bus station was very close. The concierge was very polite and helpful!! CONS: The restaurant's buffet was very dull and not so fresh!!! I don't know about the a la carte selection. I would definitely recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK location! Very clean and good sleep..”
Reviews.Author: arktinenkoira
Reviews.Content: The room was located in the furthermost corner in second floor. It was very spacious and had huge and comfy bed! We didn't take brekafast as it was very expensive (19€ ?!) but there is a nice bakery closeby for takeaways. Hotel is 7 minutes from Alexanderplatz by walking so you get going easily. We found out that the best way to move around is by bicycle. Hotel rents them for a good price. Also tickets for local transportation can be bought from concierge! All-in-all a good experience! If you wish to stay in the midst of hussle'n'bussle try something else instead.

Reviews.Title: “much less than expected”
Reviews.Author: IlanCohen
Reviews.Content: We (my wife , my son age 17 and me) for 1 week. We asked a room for 3 adults. We got a deluxe room which eas quite big and the 3'd bad was the open sofa which is in the size for 2 childs but to thin for a 17 years old. The problem is taht the bath and sink is opened to the room so threr was no privacy especially for my wife. The moment someone is having a shower it is very noisy again becawse the bath is open. Another problem is that that there is one switch for the light to to the bath area and toilets so if you use the toilets in thr night you have a light in the room (very stupid). The wi-fi is to expensive. The breakfast was quite good. Some of the stuff in the reception were rude and not friendly. As a member of the Lenardo hotels is should get 1 hour wi-fi free and almost every day there was aproblem getting the code/ They sent an email to the headqurter but never got an answer (also me). There is almost nothing close to the hotel but yes a 2 resterunts but when a host ask if there is something close they sent her 15 minutes away. The consiege waqs very helpfull. But again if you stay for 6 nights the room is very important and this was a desoster for what we needed. Staying before 2 times at the Ivberg premium hotel was muh better (free intenet).

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: steveyes2001
Reviews.Content: Nice, friendly staff, clean, good location, great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean, snazzy rooms in a convenient neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: dcshaw
Reviews.Content: Great place, very helpful concierge service, and wonderful restaurants for Berliners within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “E X C E L L E N T in every way”
Reviews.Author: Angelika40
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have choosen a better hotel. It was very centric, near Alexanderplatz and had a Bus and Tram stop almost infront. All the staff is very helpful and friendly. The room we were in was very comfortable and clean, not a single noise. The breakfast buffett was more than enough with a big variety of food. We definetly will stay again next time we're in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel Close to AlexandraPlatz”
Reviews.Author: Jobev_11
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Hotel and greeted by very polite reception staff,booking in without any problems at all, our room was of a good size, toilet and large shower, coffee/tea facilities, wonderful large soft bed with plenty of pillows, the room was aircond and was extremely clean and well fitted out. Breakfast was buffet style and was more than sufficient, although busy with 'tourist' (as we were) continental/full cooked breakfast, dining room staff most helpful replenishing food when required so no shortages of choice. Tram and Bus services almost on the door, as long as you remember the number of the Tram you caught into Alexandra Platz to catch the same one on return,;;; we did not and ended up in another district totally lost. Quite a lot of building work going on in and around the Platz, long Queues at the TV Tower so gave it a miss,but walk up towards the river and the bridges and the views are excellent lots to see. All the German locals and visitors were all helpful and polite, Bars, Cafe's and Resteraunts in abundance, must see Brandenburgh Gate and try a glass of champers at the Hotel with seating outside looking up to the Gate, 16 Eur a small glass; almost had a heart attack when the bill came, but there again I am a Yorkshire man. Berlin is a very lively City lots to see, we were there 3 days and not time to see all the attractions, but a return is on our agenda. Dont forget to purchase your 3 day travel pass well worth it. Thank you for taking time out to read this and get booked.

Reviews.Title: “Good front office as well as Concierge team work”
Reviews.Author: gregntrees
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel 29-30 June 2011, I should say its more than I first expect - after read trip advisor comment : ) I 'm a tour leader travel with 22 guests. Hotel welcome us in a very good way, keys ready and made our check in process very quick and convenience. My room a bit small but understanable, its a single room . Keep on the good job ! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean, a little out of the centre”
Reviews.Author: Lonnie3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is large and modern with a bit of a corporate feel. The rooms, while small, were very clean and modern, and nice to come home to after a long day's sightseeing. The bathroom was great and a bit fancy. There was a kettle and free teabags/coffee in the room, which was the first we had seen in Europe since England! The hotel had a nice bar downstairs, very helpful staff, and a pool/fitness room, I believe. The only downside is the location- it's a little out of the centre, and a bit of a walk to the main tourist sights. The closest train station is at Alexanderplatz square, about a 5-10 minute walk away. We walked the entire distance to the Brandenburg gate one day, and it took us about 30-40 minutes. The area surrounding the hotel was pretty deserted and felt a bit "vacant" - lots of tall office/apartment blocks, but not much in the way of restaurants/shops in the immediate vicinity. It was a nice, affordable option in Berlin and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a very good hotel well situated for Alexanderplatz”
Reviews.Author: Harlington
Reviews.Content: A vg hotel, comfortable rooms, fronts onto a busy road so requesting a room at the back a good idea. Concierge lady was excellent. We did a lot of walking as it's a reasonable step (10 mins) to the Metro. Bags to see in Berlin for all & some good local restauarants (Pila round the corner to the hotel - ask the concierge - doesn't look much but good, excellent value, no frills German food) wider afield down by Alexanderplatz there's loads of choice but walking the extra bit down to the river worthwhile for better value / choice

Reviews.Title: “a surprice for teh price”
Reviews.Author: DanishTurist
Reviews.Content: This was much better than other hotels we tried i berlin for the price, we booked a early bird price, so did get this 4 star hotel rather cheep, around 80 euro, including breakfast - and that was realy good! Big selection of almost everything, danish, fruits, several milk products, a large selection of fresh fruit ect, and kind and fast service, in a nice room The rooms was in nice coleurs, and the bathroom seemed new, with big dush cabin. Nice zink, and good lightning. Ok closetspace, in room safe, and big flatscreen tv- though most german chanals, too few english langued, that was irritating Clean rooms, our in the back of the hotel, a longer walk, but that meant no traffic noice, so we could sleep with our windovs open. The location dull, rather big allë outside with rather much trafic, but also the bus 200 almost in front of the hotel and its stopping nearby all the sights in berlin. !0 minutes walk to alexander plaz with bus, U and S bahn, and shopping!!! gallerie kaufhof, big big, and then the newer shopping center alexa , whauuuw if shopping is your plan, al the international and germans labels, crocs, levis, one street, vero moda, h+m, only, st oliver, timberland, north face, jack wolfskin ect ect, for a rainy day.. Also 15 mins walk to Prenzlauger berg, kastaninen alle, yes in walking distance to almost everything. I will for sure return BUT AVOID THE SMALL ViET-THAI on the oppersite corner - the lousiest food in berlin

Reviews.Title: “Never return to a hotel Leonardo”
Reviews.Author: StrawJam
Reviews.Content: Good: Location was good. Hotel room is confortable. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Bad: Cold but polite reception at the hotel. Only informed us our room number. We know nothing about the hotel facilities. No information. The room was little sign of not bothered. Tv channels did not correspond to the list provided. The iron had something stuck, could not be used ... hole in the curtain (a cigarette), sheets with small black spots (for a cigarette, probably) and some hair, dust in many places, carpet dirty, and worst of all: trash under the bed. Disgusting. At the reception we received only a timid apology. The last day the cleaning boy came to wake up at 8:00! (as we had no sign of "bother "...).

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel with a contemporary feel”
Reviews.Author: atina2090
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. A conveniently located hotel which is close to public transport, restaurants and shops. There is also a supermarket nearby. Rooms are clean and have furnished in simple clean contemporary lines. Beds are surprisingly comfortable. Hotel staff are polite and courteous. The concierge was most helpful in providing directions and assisting us with the purchase of tickets for travel on local public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Fine Room, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Newtonian2
Reviews.Content: The Leonardo Royal Hotel is located about a ten-minute walk east of Alexanderplatz (a major transportation hub). The M4 tram stops just up the street and runs quite frequently, so it is easy to get from the hotel to most parts of the city via the fantastically efficient (albeit, on first acquaintance, rather complex) public transit system of this great city. You can purchase tickets for the tram (which will also work on U Bahn and the S Bahn trains as well as the buses) at the concierge desk: at 6.30 euro, the day pass is a no brainer (longer options are also available along with combination tickets that include museums). There's also quite a bit of material available there and in the room to help you find your way around. The hotel is also about a twenty minute walk to the heart of the leafy and trendy Prenzlauer Berg district, with its restaurants and bars. There are also trams and buses that run out that way. After going through Alexanderplatz the M4 tram continues on to Hackesche Markt with its restaurants, shops, and great old buildings (including the elegant old courtyards in the Hackesche Hof, which is worth entering, even you're not interested in the shops). The hotel itself is clean, modern, and well-equipped: it has a restaurant, gym facilities, a bar, and what appeared to be reasonably priced bike rentals (I didn't do competitive pricing). The neighborhood itself features a fine bakery/coffee shop up the street (Melis Cafe and Bakery) as well as an excellent "Orientalische & Mediterrane" (i. e. cosmopolitan Turkish) restaurant called Merhaba just a block further up the street in the direction away from Alexanderplatz (Otto Braun Strasse changes its name to Greifswalderstrasse at the intersection where Melis Coffee is located). There's a large park (the Volkspark Freidrichshain) just up the street in the same direction, which dates from the 1840s and features a fountain built around 1900 with various fairy tale animals —the day I passed through it was filled with families. As a clean, modern, reasonably priced hotel with quick access to all that Berlin has to offer (most tourists will want to stay in the old "East Berlin" rather than the West, since the heart of the city has moved back there since the reunification) the Leonardo is an excellent choice. The staff was consistently helpful during our time in Berlin. They were able to check us into our room at around 9:30 AM on the day of our arrival, which allowed us to leave our bags in the room, change our clothes, and begin our assault on Berlin. They were also enormously helpful during a rough patch when my wife was injured in an accident and had to be hospitalized for a few days. They extended our booking at the discounted rate we'd originally gotten and helped me to work out the logistics of getting back and forth to the hospital, which was located on the far south western edge of the city. Berlin is a fascinating place to visit and almost any halfway decent hotel will probably suffice (after all, you're there for the city, not for the room). It's when things turn nasty that you learn whether you're staying at a really good hotel: though we'd have preferred not to put the Leonardo to that test, it passed with flying colors.

Reviews.Title: “We felt unwanted and overlooked in the midst of business conventions.”
Reviews.Author: LouLouPGarou
Reviews.Content: We booked a classic double room and were quite excited to go to this hotel, as it was our first vacation without family in five years! Needless to say that we were disappointed to get to the front desk and find two aloof desk clerks. We were put on the 6th floor (top floor) at the very back of the hotel, involving a long walk to the room (which even involved several steps of a landing that we had to drag the cases up and down, as there was no ramp.) It was stiflingly hot in our room, even with the AC on the coldest setting. The room was cramped and the tv faced the front door, not the bed! (But there was nothing but German tv without subtitles available anyway, unfortunately). We slept poorly - the bed head tilted down and made my husband dizzy, while I had night sweats from the heat. (Opening the windows was too much noise from the busy main road outside). We told the woman at the desk about the AC and she looked at us blankly, asking several times if we'd made sure we'd turned it on properly. She finally agreed to send a mechanic to the room that day. We returned to the room later to find that not much seemed changed, but we were willing to give the room another night. (We passed the same receptionist later that night, but she neglected to ask us if it was improved, nor did she greet us at all). Another blazingly hot night resulted in my staggering exhaustedly down to the desk at 5am and requesting a new room. We were given a new, comfortabe and normal room with AC that was much improved and we were much happier. I must say that the room was exactly like the photos and was very nice. Overall we found the staff to be disinterested, the hotel packed with noisy business conventions, (resulting in loud conversations outside in the courtyard/convention area beginning at 8am and ending at 12:30 or 1am,) no clocks in the rooms, the tea bags provided in the room weren't replaced when we used them...suffice it to say that there wasn't much of an effort to go the extra mile to take care of a romantic couple when the business guests were there! I would love to stay at this hotel under different circumstances, and would hope that the management would take steps to cater to more than just business guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: travelabit
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good, and is in a location that will allow you to get a good nights sleep. The beds and sheet quality are good. Breakfast and internet are expensive. You can get some discount if you purchase breakfast at check in, or chose a room rate that has breakfast included. The tram goes right past the hotel, and the stop is very close. Warning, taxi drivers in Berlin like to give you the scenic tour of the city on the trip to your hotel, so if you aren't carrying too much luggage or are not too jet lagged consider following the directions on the site on how to get there by transit. I would still take a taxi if you are in a group, or have some luggage that you don't want to have to drag on/off of trains and trams. Staff were friendly, and I was able to check in early as my room was ready. The reception can get very busy, so some times you will have to wait a bit. Factor that into your check out timing if you have a flight or train to catch. Tip to get the taps at the sink to flow water, push the handle away from the spout, up and down just controls the water temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel.. highly impressed”
Reviews.Author: JenNZ12
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Well priced. Staff and concierge efficent. Location was very good only a 10 minute walk to the centre. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. This was the start of our 4 wee European adventure and by far this was the best hotel for all categories, cleanieness, location, rate and rooms. We were highly impressed and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Grea Hotel, creat stay”
Reviews.Author: mecla
Reviews.Content: Extremely pleased with it ... got a good on-line rate ... got a complimentary upgrade for staying the week ... beautiful breakfast ... great location: take the streecar or bus to anywhere. When in Berlin, wouldn't stay aywhere else (for that money)!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: larry_downy
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in the hotel just for one night. I arrived early, but the girl from the reception checked me in, and that was really good! The room was rather big. Very nice bed. There is a very pretty yard, where we spent our evening with the bottle of wine. The location is also quite good - close to Alexandr Platz and the Bus stop is just in front of the hotel. There is a fitness centre. The sauna works only in the evening, probably I would recommend to make it work in the morning also - at least under the guest's request. The only thing we didn't like- Wi Fi - which was very very expensive. I don't know about the price in other hotels in Germany, but it was too much in Leonardo, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: hollie283
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended - room was spatious, clean and fresh looking. Staff friendly and very helpful. Food great and bar lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: aalyela
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Leonardo Royal for 6 pleasant nights. The hotel was modern, clean, rooms were nice and the service was excellent. The location was great because the hotel is situated so that you can easily explore Berlins different parts. We liked to most Prenzlauer Berg, Mitte and Kreuzberg (lots of second hand and other cool shops, bars, cafes and restaurants). The only con was that there wasn't so much to see right there where to hotel was located. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel because it was so expensive: 14 € / person if you order it in advance, otherwise 19 €. I'm sure the breakfast would have been excellent but we were happy to eat in different place every day, since there was lots and lots of great breakfast & brunch places in Berlin. And much cheaper. I used the gym in the top floor couple times and it was ok for me. I got to excercise all by myself which was great. We tried the sauna once but it was so small and crowded that we didn't go twice. All in all the hotel was good experience and we would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: Mousoudi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful.Nice modern design and very clean.The staff was extremely helpful,especially the concierge Stephanie(i hope i say the name correctly) was very friendly , knew what was saying and helped us a lot.

Reviews.Title: “More than good.....”
Reviews.Author: Nikhst
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel 3nights. It was more than. It was more than I was expecting. Clean, quiet and friendly environment. The staff were very polite and helpfull, they were smiling all the time. And our breaκfast and dinner was just delicious!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just so Good!!”
Reviews.Author: Longlivelife
Reviews.Content: We came on a weekend break so our point of view would differ from a business traveller, We took a deluxe room so space was not a problem. It was spotless and very quiet, overlooking an inner courtyard. Church bells nearby stopped at 21.00 and started again at 08.00 so not a disturbance. Really good firm mattress. 32" flat screen TV with sofa was very welcome after a long day on our feet. Room was very warm so we turned off the heating and left the all the windows open while we were out. Bathroom opened directly onto the room, which means it didn't have a door. However, for those unused to sharing EVERYthing, the loo was separate and did have a door! There was also a bath with a shower head the size of a dust-bin lid! I was surprised to see that the shower gel and shampoo were generic products, nothing special. The room also had a little office area with a desk and chair. All the usual accessories were in the room; the ironing board, the safe, sewing kit, shoe shine. We didn't read the information pack immediately and so bought blades and shaving cream in the supermarket . Perhaps they should be provided in the room instead of held in reception. The mini-bar was off limits. What is it with water in Berlin? The minibar water was 6.5 euro for a bottle and we were charged 5.80 in a restaurant outside. We stuck to tap water at meals and bought it in the supermarket otherwise. What can I say about the breakfast? Fantastic!! Fresh fruit, all the cereals, seeds, juices, yoghurts, eggs anyway you like, bacon, sausages, ham, cheeses, breads, pastries, coffee and a selection of teas all served until 10.30. Dinner is served in the evening. It is not inexpensive, best described as fine dining, the staff are very attentive and the food is excellent and well presented. There is also a bar and lounge and 3 computers and a printer. We weren’t interested in room wi-fi. Didn’t have time to check out the leisure centre. Check in is 15.00 but there is a little room off reception where you may leave your luggage if you come in on an early morning flight. Check in is swift and painless. The concierge was fantastic. She had loads of tips and information, spoke 5 languages and clearly loved her job. Museum and travel passes are on sale here and even postcards. Location wise Alexanderplatz is a 10 min walk straight down the road. The museum island is another 10 minute walk beyond it. The tram stops 50 mt from the hotel door, end of the line is 200 mt from museum island. From the hotel Unter den Linden is the far side of Alexanderplatz., Kadewa and the Sony Centre are a 6 -8 stops on the underground. With its proximity to the A/platz hub the hotel could not be described as out of the way although it is a quiet area. Totally recommend this hotel, keep an eye out for offers and go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in every way!”
Reviews.Author: SuePete4
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel, as usual, after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. The positive ones were not wrong! This is a fantastic hotel. It is new, trendy, spotlessly clean, with amazingly comfortable beds, modern bathroom (shower only). There was a kettle in the room with tea & coffee provided, a hairdryer, 30" flat-screen TV and even an iron & ironing board in the wardrobe! PLUS for social lepers like ourselves, smoking rooms are available (big bonus!) The staff were wonderful-polite, cheery and very helpful. Breakfasts were superb. Hot buffet consisted of scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages & some little beef-burgers. There was a wide variety of fresh fruits, yoghurts, cereals, breads & rolls, fruit juices, jams, honey, marmalade, tea & coffee, hot chocolate, fruit & herbal teas, latte, cappuccino & espresso coffees. The ONLY slight drawback is the location. The hotel is in the east side of the city, around 10-15 minutes walk from Alexanderplatz. There are very few bars and restaurants near the hotel, BUT there is a fabulous little Argentinian (!) bar/bistro called "Las Malvanas" just around the corner. Turn left out of the hotel, take the first street on the left, and it is about 20-30 yards on your left. The food is very good & cheap-about 3 or 4 Euros for a large pizza or plate of pasta. I know there is a saying "you can't please everyone" but I really don't understand what some people expect from a hotel. In my opinion, any criticism about this hotel is unfair & unjustified! This hotel is part of a chain. For my next city break, I wouldn't be thinking "Where can I go", I'd ask "Which city has a Leonardo Royal hotel?"

Reviews.Title: “Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Iknowgoodfood1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in loads of hotels in Berlin and I believe this one is the best value-for-money hotel! I booked a room for 60euros/night which is really really cheap for the quality of this hotel. Rooms are lovely, not extremely spacious but doesn't matter, very warm, very modern, beds are very comfortable. Way above my expectations for the price!

Reviews.Title: “If you are in Berlin, stay in Royal Leonardo”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: Had the chance to stay there during a long weekend. Located 10 minutes walk from Alexanderplatz (or 3 minutes by tram M4) New, excellently decorated rooms with a really enjoyable shower and ultra comfy beds. TV has about 45 channels, so plenty of shows to choose from. Staff is extremely friendly and ready to help. When we are back in Berlin, we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Svetik723
Reviews.Content: Very good location, friendly staff. Quite big room with new furniture, reach breakfast and free sauna and hammam. We really enjoed staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its publicity - and that's what I want a hotel to do!”
Reviews.Author: SteveW1
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, great range of choice at breakfast. Clean as a whistle. Located 10 mins (walking), 4 mins (Tram) from Alexanderplatz transport hub so loaction not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Leonardo”
Reviews.Author: dorise45
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to Alexanderplatz, quiet, clean, friendly staff and great breakfasts. What more could you want? We stayed for 3 nights. Excellent value. I would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DerekPMitcham
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for a 4 night break with friends in January 2011. The welcome was excellent and that set the theme for the rest of the trip. The hotel rooms are, to be terribly honest, a little smaller than ideal but what they lose in size they make up for in service and comfort. The bed was superbly comfortable and every member of staff we encountered was friendly and helpful. The concierge service was tremendous - make sure you get public transport tickets from the desk as we saved €10 a day by getting a 'small group' (maximum 5 people) combined ticket for trains, trams and buses for €15. Public transport is fast and frequent although there are occasional walks between metro lines at the same station! The inclusive breakfast was comprehensive and substantial. Exceptional value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: RachelMS
Reviews.Content: It is the most amazing hotel that I've been in Europe! Starting with the elegant warm and beautiful decoration of the hotel and the room, Continuing with the amazing breakfast and finishing with the excellent and patient service, especially at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to come back to after exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: WhaleBay
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Berlin before, I wasn't sure about the Leonardo Royal's location as we wanted somewhere as a base to explore the city and didn't fancy to much of a trek to get to the action as we had a pram in tow. As it happens, it's location is not an issue and in fact has its benefits. The hotel is located about 5-10 minutes to touristy Alexander Platz. However, the real benefit of its location is its proximity to the leafy suburbs of Prenzlouer Berg and the edge of Friedrichshain, which have a great collection of restaurants with some great food seemingly only discovered by the locales. Two recommendations: il Pane e le rose (Italian - try the ravioli) on Am Friedrichshain and Aznavourian (French) on the corner of Rykestrasse and Knaackstrasse both of which are about 15 mins walk from the hotel. The efficient metro and trams makes it easy to access any of Berin's sights but it's just as easy to walk to better discover the city. The hotel itself and its rooms are all reasonably new and modern. We took three rooms for our stay including one junior suite to give us more space with a toddler and pram. The junior suite was not much more expensive than the other rooms and the added space was great for all of us to sit around in the evenings. So worth it if you are travelling in a small group! The junior suite came with a stocked Nespresso coffee maker too, which was good. The other rooms could have been slightly larger but it was enough to take away from the rooms too much. The hotel also has a sauna & steam room beside the rooftop gym. Overall, this was great hotel to return to after a day exploring the sights of Berlin and I would recommend it for anyone visiting Berlin for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Femaleram
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend break in Berlin and would recommend staying here. The breakfast is high quality and the staff throughout the hotel are very friendly. The beds are very comfortable, probably the best nights sleep I've had away from home. You can get the M4 tram from the stop to the right of the hotel, this takes you to Alexanderplatz and then you can get the 'S' trains or underground to other parts of the city. We were always able to get our '10 minutes' on the internet and when reception ordered a taxi it arrived within 5 minutes. Berlin is a great city with a cheap, varied and excellent transport system that runs 24 hours a day. We wouldn't think twice about booking this hotel when we come back, hopefully that will be soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MonicaMendes
Reviews.Content: I stayed from 13 Oct to 17 Oct (4 nights) with my husband and family. I got to the hotel by bus from the airport. The hotel is not in the center, but you have bus and tram just a few minutes from de hotel, you can also get to Alexanderplatz max. 10 minutes walk. The room was great, nice and cosy, you hav a mini bar , you could make some tea (4 diffrent kinds) and in some rooms you had a Nespresso machine (superior room), internet (didn´t use, don't know the cost). The room was very clean, had a big confortable sofa, and also had a iron and a table (you can use it for free). In the lobby hotel, you could buy tickets (transports), stamps, postcards (no need for postoffice), and you also have a room with computer and internet. The breakfast was really great, variety, quality, good environment, very kind and helpfull staff. The one thing i didn't like, was the fact that because i had to catch an early flight i had to leave the hotel at 6:00 am, i asked the hotel for an early breakfast the night before and all i got was one solo tinny croissant, tea, coffee or milk, no fruit and nothing to make a sandwich to take. Very unpleasant since i paid for the breakfast when i booked the room. I surely recomend this hotel, but notice that is not right in the city center, but you have good transports from and to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile stay”
Reviews.Author: JackP47
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four nights, five days. My wife, two adult children, and another 30 friends. The service is excellent, friendly and efficient. The breakfast is very rich and well-prepared. The hotel is clean, and the rooms are very comfortable. It is only five minutes away from Alexanderplatz. I would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ita050663
Reviews.Content: We were in Berlin for the Marathon and had a great time. The staff in the Leonardo Royal were very helpful and nice. Santino one of the bar staff was exceptional and we had him extremely busy making cocktails for us on the three nights we were there. He was good fun and even sat for a photograph with us on the last night! As for the hotel itself, it was very clean and the rooms were compact but lovely! The breakfast buffet catered for everybody's individual tastes with an abundance of lovely food and several types of breads. All in all a great time was had in Berlin!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel / excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: gsza
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a total of five nights, split in three and two. overall the hotel is the best value for money. Location: very close to Alexanderplaz and other interesting locations. Good commute with tram and bus to all central locations. Very convenient. Breakfast: best money can buy. Don't be afraid to book it because you will not regret it. Room: very large (although it was not their luxurious) with enough furniture and storage facilities. It even had iron and board. very good temperature control as well. Bed: very comfortable and truly queen-size Staff: polite and helpful. Internet: this was the only downside. No free wifi (although this seems to be the norm in Berlin). Price for wifi was in my opinion outrageous. 3 public PCs which were most of the time occupied (definitely in rush hour) by other guests, who did not respect the 10 minute time limit (it was not obligatory). Since I was not about to start a dispute over it, most times I just left without being able to use it. It also has a gym which we didn't use This hotel cost us about 350 euros for 5 nights and we did not book as early in advance as we could have. This, to me, is an excellent value for money and I would recommend it strongly.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: rdhillon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our first wedding anniversary. Upon arrival staff are very welcoming and they upgraded our room as it was a special occassion. When we got to our room the room was spacious, modern, clean and well done. We loved our stay at the hotel and strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fleur007
Reviews.Content: Positive: Modern and clean rooms and you can open the windows. Lobby was nice, there were enough elevators. Negative: Reception told us that there was a bath in the room, which wasn't there. Congierge was al the time extremly busy. P.S. free parking is behind the hotel will save you 18 euros a night!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, excellent breakfast, convenient price, good location in East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: davaz
Reviews.Content: Well-equipped standard rooms, including flat-screen TV. But they are relatively small. Chose an upgraded room for an additional minimum per day.Alexander Platz distance is 10 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: perretto
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend during 3 nights in this hotel. The hotel is very clean and modern. Our double room were quite small, but this is not important to me. The bed was great and bathroom was not big, but not too small either. The breakfast were really good, a lot to chose from and fresh. The staff were really nice and willing to help. The only negative is that they don't have free wifi. There are 3 computers in the lobby which is for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deluxe Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jelena J
Reviews.Content: Do ...stay here if you don´t mind dull surroundings Don't ...stay here if you´d like to walk into the city center. The hotel is just a few tram stops away from the Alexanderplatz. Modern, new hotel with quiet rooms. Deluxe rooms have free Wired/W-LAN internet access. Great breakfast. Helpfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excelent bedroom breakfast and staff, very clean and almost a great location”
Reviews.Author: Linha
Reviews.Content: Me and my mom have stayed in this hotel for vacation time in Berlin. The staff was actually very kind and helpful and the bedroom was excelent. (we got a Deluxe twin one) and extremely clean! Breaksfast was great, full of options and not expensive if you pay for it in the whole package deal. The location was good, near a bus stop, tram stop and a "U". The point is that we're "walkers", and when it comes to the end of the day, when you're tired and wanting to get back to a hot shower, the distance seems to be a little longer than it was in the morning. Berlin is great city, very safe, and in summer time we still have sun at 10pm, so walking was not that big deal.... Definetly would stay here again and no doubt we would recommend it to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Very Very helpful staff Great Breakfast good location”
Reviews.Author: tomersi
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Leonardo hotel from the 19/05 until the 23/05 The hotel is very clean, the room is big and comfortable. The staff is very very nice and helpful The location is just 2 tram stops from Alexander Plaze (5 Min walking) The breakfast is very very good I will defiantly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: free-spirit2273
Reviews.Content: I found a very good deal for 3 nights. the hotel is fantastic, close to main connections. the staff is very helpful. i strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “The most amazingly helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: JanetBrussels
Reviews.Content: We were knocked out by how welcoming and helpful the staff were. We had a problem with the water in our room, and although it took time to sort it out, the matter was well handled. The breakfast is good goes on until a reasonable hour, and a bargain if you get an all-in deal. We had an excellent meal in the restaurant, and again friendly helpful staff. We'd pre-requested a double bed, and as there weren't any available in the category we had booked when we arrived we were immediately up-graded. The room and all the hotel facilities we used were very clean. Sadly, because there are so many good things about this hotel, there are also some negatives: Nearby Alexander Platz is not beautiful, and the hotel is quite a bit out of the main centre ... and we got stranded at pedestrian lights watching the tram or bus sail past several times! However, both run frequently. The wellness centre is tiny , 6 person hammam and sauna for a large hotel (and it only opens from 5pm but I guess this isn't a problem for most tourists). Although I liked this hotel very much I might think about finding somewhere more central another time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Great staff”
Reviews.Author: GePAthens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a week in May. It's very close to Alexanderplatz in a walking distance of 10 minutes. Still, a tram station is right outside the hotel. The staff was very helpful and kind and always ready to help us. The breakfast was rich including about 6 kinds of coffee. Note that free internet is available in the hotel at 3 computers in a special room. I strongly recommend it. If I ever go again to Berlin, I'll surely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok, but we somehow expected more”
Reviews.Author: LU-town
Reviews.Content: This is a modern and well maintained hotel, which ist very clean and has nice staff. Our room (Nr. 576, in a side wing, not looking onto the main road) was allright, but appeared to be very small. It's ok if you only stay there to sleep, but you would not want to spend more time in it, especially not, if you're two people. We staied at the hotel for three days in total, and during two days we had no hot water (only tepid water) in our room. The only thing they said was that they had a general problem and that they were sorry about it... As for the location, we liked it pretty much, because we were looking for a hotel which is not in the middle of the very center of tourist activities. All in all it was ok, but considering the price we paid, we somehow expected more from the hotel. By the way: For those complaining about the high prices for breakfast: We found a nice café just around the corner, where you get breakfast for some 5 € and free wireless internet (Melis Coffee, Corner Am Friedrichshain/Greifswalder Str.). You may want to check this one out.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelinmaven
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel at a great price. The room was large, quiet and had the most comfortable bed and pillows. Service was outstanding. The location is very accessible to public transportation. There is a very nice bar, and we enjoyed a good dinner in the restaurant our first night in Berlin. We would definitely return there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but rooms are too small”
Reviews.Author: MMmd
Reviews.Content: Good: New hotel, the decor, the shower, the restaurant Not so good: a) The size of the room (Classic). It is too small for 2 persons to share if staying more than one night. There is only one chair in the room!!! b) The location. It is at least 10 minutes walk from the nearest metro underground station which is located at Alexanderplatz. This is longer than you think when it is raining and especially when you arrive in the middle of a large square and do not know where the hotel is. Other points: 1. In the bathroom the washbasin is very modern and of unusual design but it leaves very little room to place your toiletries nearby if two of you are sharing. 2. Although there are tea and coffee making facilities in the room, they provide 1 sachet of coffee and one teabag of normal tea for a two person room!! 3. You have to telephone the reception for a code before you use the internet. Be careful they will give you the code for the premium internet service which is 17.80euro per day rather than the standard 11.80euro/day. The standard rate is more than adequate for most purposes. 4. The book describing the hotel services in the room says they serve breakfast in the room and you need to fill in the forms and hang them on the door. There were no such forms in our room and it would have been a challenge I would have liked to see. How do you serve breakfast for 2 persons in a room with one chair!! 5. On checking out, without asking, they charge your credit card in your own currency (in our case UK pounds) rather than euro. The result is that you pay 2 exchange rates. You only make this mistake once. You should always ask the credit card charge to be made in the local currency of the hotel or shop. Would I stay here again? If I was on my own with my own car, probably I would stay again. If I had to rely on public transport or was sharing the room, I would try and find another hotel nearer the town centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for value, not great location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ErikHof
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the price. The location and atmosphere of the hotel are not great. The breakfast was good and the gym was nice as well. The hallways of the hotel are not very cosy and the rooms a bit small but okay.

Reviews.Title: “good value, but be careful to the special "open" toilet room!”
Reviews.Author: serena71
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some considerable plus: ten minuts walking distance from Alexander platz, clean and good quality/price factor. My room (a superior) was clean and wide. But You can choose this hotel only if you have a very very close and "no-taboo" relation with you travelling-partner/friend: the toilet space of my room was just on the left of the queen-bed and with no door (just the wc is in a very very small space closed by a door). so if you have to take a shower or wash yourself, consider you are..."open air". That's quite strange, really and may create embarace. If this is not problem for you, try this hotel. Staff kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel, great value !”
Reviews.Author: HJenThomas
Reviews.Content: Great trendy hotel in a great city. Hotel is new and a typical german hotel. Clean, trendy and friendly. Rooms are great and clean. Location perfect (near Alexanderplatz). Staff very friendly. Everyday a cocktail of the day. The barkeeper was very friendly and makes great cocktails ! I hope the price stays low because they are worth much more ! When i have to make one point of comment: the parking was very expensive. But i think that normal in Berlin, only there where plenty of spaces behing the hotel so the price could be a bit more friendly. And the breakfast was GREAT !

Reviews.Title: “5 night in Leonardo Royal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: antonistal
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and the room very clear. The breakfast unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Macabre
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and I would recommend it to anyone. We stayed there for five nights in December 2009. The staff were extremely helpful, professional and friendly, and provided superb service; the breakfast was absolutely excellent; the room, a superior room (we were upgraded at no additional charge when we arrived early on our first day as the room that we had booked wasn't ready yet), was very comfortable and had BBC World and CNN; and the rate that we were charged was very reasonable (I think around 80 Euro per night). The hotel is perhaps a 20 minutes or so walk to Alexanderplatz, and a 30 minute plus walk to the museums, but that didn't really bother us. We will definitely be staying there again when we return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: claudio28
Reviews.Content: i booked a superior room and i stayed 4 nights from 16/12 till 20/12 . Everything was great. VERY helpfull staff!! The breakfast was perfect. The location very good, only 2 tram stops( 4 minutes) from alexanderplatz or 6 minutes in walking distance. the room was big enough with a view to the nearby church (room 232) very modern with great bed matress and a nice bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: seriouslynonames
Reviews.Content: The room was modern, clean, comfortable and welcoming. Very nice bathrooms, too. Good, complimentary breakfast. Not the most amazing location, but well-served by public transport and therefore in easy reach of most major attractions. I would recommend this hotel for both business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class ALL THE WAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dubai-Mafia
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the way back to the UK from Czech, and that possibly was one of the best decisions i made. For £60 for 2, i was more than impressed!!! This hotel had complete luxury throughout the hotel. Lobby, rooms EVERYTHING IS 5 STAR!!!! The rooms are very modern with amazing beds + super luxury bathrooms! VERY VERY clean. Staff are the best i have ever seen as they will do anything to please you!!! Very central location and cant say enough how modern and lush this hotel is! Parking is limited though so don't get there at 11pm like i did, or you wont get a place. Parking is FREE but first come first serve. Great start to visiting Berlin!!

Reviews.Title: “Leonardo Royal”
Reviews.Author: garynolan
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in deed , the walk from the centre can be a little daunting after a day sightseeing but well worth the effort !! The hotel probably has the most helpful and friendly staff we have encountered in various hotel stays in various countries. Breakfast was not too impressive but was more than adequate. The room was really nice fantastic shower and bathroom and very very comfortable beds . Would I stay there again ....YES !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Anaxagordas
Reviews.Content: No problems very good breakfast nice room quiet facing the back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, beautiful rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Manctravellers99
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights in November, pre-booked directly on the website for 55 euros a night (premier Inn territory in England!) The hotel feels anything but Premier Inn level the rooms are really well decorated (Samsung flat screen TV, waterfall shower) we were front facing but were not affected by the noise even on a busy road. My boyfriend is 6' 5" so we had been slightly concerned about the size of the bed as had heard they would be 2 singles pushed together we shouldnt have as it turned out to be a massive queen size bed. Location is perfect 5 mins walk to Alexanderplatz, 5 mins to Prenzleurberg where there is an abundance of cafes, resturants and bars. Tram stop right outside if you dont like to walk. Previous reviews have mentioned it being out of the way but it really is only 5 mns away from the main S & U bahn stops and the decor and hotel more than outweigh that 5 min walk. I really couldnt fault the hotel in any way, having arrived in Berlin and then finding out my bag had been left in Liverpool by easyjet this hotel actually improved my mood!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - clean and friendly but just a little far from the u-bahn”
Reviews.Author: FCHEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: A really great hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff, with a clean and well equipped room. The only (very minor) downside was the 10-15min walk to the nearest underground. To be fair, there is a tram very nearby, so I can't complain really! We plan to stay again and would happily recommend it to friends...

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Th0masN0rway
Reviews.Content: I did order the room thru Expedia and did pay something like 90€ for a night. Its a good value I think because this hotel are great. Its huge size. Super at check in, bellboy helpful, rooms great and everything is new. All in all the best hotel I ever have been in this price range, except in Thailand off course. But if I shall find something to complain about its Internet, its slow and you pay big time. 18€ for 24 hrs. I think is to much. What the %##%#!& is the problem to give people free access in 2009? Also the restaurant...its modern and the food also. We are all different, but I like the classic steak better with some potatoes and pepper sauce then fried noodles and wok. But the service and the staff there stands for 6 if I throw the dice. VERY good service in restaurant, the woman and the man was great! All in all - a fantastic hotel for the price if you will stay in east-Berlin. Now I will go to bed and sleep very happy. Thats the way it shall be on a hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Brand New & Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: UWSider
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the first month post-opening and very glad I did! Respecting the landmark status of this East Berlin location, the facade has been judicously restored. Interiors have kept historic fixtures, but all else is brilliantly clean and modern. I was alone, but I can see why professional groups would choose well in selecting the Leonardo Royal. the breakfast buffet is sumptuous--nothing has been left out! The bar is great--open and comfy, nice staff. Gernd, the concierge, is exactly how concierges should be--welcoming, informative, caring. My room was so bright and warmly modern. Gorgeous bathroom, grand bed and linens. I peeked into the meeting rooms--they forgot nothing--all the equipment and setting were ideal--soon, a grand ballroom. Glad I looked! The are is eclectic--in one direction you have the throbbing Alexander Platz. The other way--you can see this is becoming a very "IN" quarter for young people. Then there's the Prenzlauer Berg: similar to Greenwich Village and SoHo and with the traditional Orthodox Jewish community--all combined! So each day I took an new walking route.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: HeyDAVEScotland
Reviews.Content: New hotel so it's in good condition and nicely decorated. The standard double rooms are pretty small and space is very limited in bathroom. Fantastic shower though! The breakfast was ok but for convenience it was great to have this included within room rate. The location is good for Alexanderplatz and trams run near to hotel but there's not too much on the doorstep. All in all excellent value for the price but the room size doesn't warrant paying any more.

Reviews.Title: “Leonardo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JavierZGZ
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife arrives to the Leonardo last Aug 13th, When we arrive the Hotel wasnot already finished. They had accepted reservation one day before first day. I though that this will bring us several problems in our stay. We did the checking in desk fast and correctly. The staff were really usefull. When we arrive to our floor the lobby was totally dusty and the corridors were covered with plastics, on my room the courtains was over the bed, It was not already hooked. Once was resolved these, we can check that the room was very nice deco. Good bathroom and plasma TV on the room. The Hotel is very nice, good looking and designed in a new art deco style. Location is good close to Alexanderplatz but not metro station close to hotel you must use the tram. Two station to Alexanderplatz. Very recommended option for Berlin.
